headline: Peanut Butter Bars
description: These peanut butter bars are rich, creamy, and taste just like peanut butter cups. Made with just 5 ingredients, these no-bake bars are easy to make.

video.description: If you love chocolate and peanut butter together, these are the bars for you.
video.name: Peanut Butter Bars I

name: Peanut Butter Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together graham cracker crumbs, confectioners' sugar, butter or margarine, and 1 cup peanut butter in a medium bowl until well-blended. Press evenly into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13-inch pan.
Place chocolate chips and 4 tablespoons peanut butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high, stirring every 15 seconds, until smooth. Spread mixture over crust.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before cutting into 12 squares.

review.reviewBody: I have made these for years and they are known in my circles as “Tracey’s Bars”, as in: “have Tracey bring her peanut butter bars.” Made as is, they are divine. However, over the years I have tweaked the recipe to take them next level. I add approximately 1.5 tsp of vanilla, 1/2 tsp salt, and I reduce the powdered sugar to between 1.5 and 1 3/4 cup powdered sugar. All of these measurements are approximate as I don’t measure anything anymore. I just toss it in. Also, I use only crunchy Jif peanut butter. If you haven’t made these before, do yourself a favor and make them.
EASY. Delicous , FATTENING LOL.

These are a quick, inexpensive, easy to make, and very good fresh homemade treat! Better than paying for overpriced snacks that have been sitting around on a shelf. If you’re considering trying this recipe and like the ingredients listed you won’t be disappointed. Also if you read these reviews and see lower stars and negative comments, all I can say is those folks must have jacked up the recipe!

I have made these bars for decades, calling them Stompers Delights, after a recipe in Vogue. I don't use a mixer, but get in there with my hands - much easier. I smooth the peanut butter/graham cracker/10X sugar mixture very carefully, particularly along the edges and in the corners, to make it absolutely even, often using a small fondant rolling pin. After pouring on the chocolate, let the whole thing cool at room temperature - much easier to cut - or keep checking the chocolate if you do use the fridge. It can be very difficult to cut when completely hardened. Sometimes I drizzle melted peanut butter chips across the top for decoration before cutting. And sometimes I use chunky peanut butter instead of smooth, for added texture.

While this tasted good and almost too rich, the "crust" portion was not thick enough to press into a pan, just poured, and the chocolate portion didn't cover the top as shown and I used a smaller pan. Check proportions of melted butter in crust and maybe add more chocolate chips!

I've made these for years and it tastes just like Reeses Peanut Butter Cups. I make mine in a sheet pan and spread melted Cadbury chocolate bars on top with an offset spatula. They really do need to be refrigerated or they get too soft.
OH MY GOSH THIS WAS SO GOOD

These are super easy to make & best eaten out of the freezer, just like Reese's. To make cutting them easier, score the chocolate layer with a thin, sharp paring knife cleaned carefully with a paper towel between cuts. I do this with Nanaimo bars, too. The best timing to score the chocolate is about 1h at room temp, or 15m in the fridge, after assembly. The chocolate has set up slightly but is still easy to cut then & will retain the cuts so when you slice the bars fully later (best is after overnight in the fridge), the chocolate won't crack too much, if at all.
Great recipe and easy to follow directions! I also made the creamy frosting to go with it.

I had to improvise. I’m a head cook at a nursing home and this was on the menu and I’ve never made it before. So instead of chocolate chips I used Hershey chocolate syrup and mixed it with PB it came out awesome. It wasn’t too sweet for the elderly and I look forward to tweak it the recipe for next time thank you !

Cheaper than buying peanut butter cups, and you know what’s in it! I love this recipe. Same as the one my mom made when I was little. I’ll probably half the batch next time, it makes a lot of bars. :) Delicious!
Our youth group couldn't get enough of these! Love them and very easy to make

I got the recipe for these from my 1st grade teacher from 1980 after I was an adult with my own kids. • If your peanut butter base is too soft, then add more Graham crackers and powdered sugar until it’s VERY stiff. It SHOULD be tough to knead! • Use parchment paper on the bottom of the pan. • For the chocolate topping, melt some butter in a non stick skillet on med-low heat and add the chocolate chips to it until melted. DON’T overcook the chocolate chips! Pour it onto the base AS SOON AS the chips are melted and spread evenly. They are the best home made Reese’s Peanut Butter cups ever! 👍
Loved this easy recipe. I changed it up a little by adding raisins to the chocolate layer. Yummy
this is delicious made it many times last time they had no gram cracker crumbs , so i use chocolate cookie crumbs so delicious
First I've made. Quick n easy. Didn't have graham crackers so I crushed corn flakes. Everyone liked ,em.

My first time making these, came out really good! I followed recipe and took suggestions from other comments. I melted the butter & PB together and did chill peanut butter base for @20 minutes before adding chocolate. I also used Nestle Toll House Milk Chocolate and it was yummy. Going to make again but will add a bit more PB in the graham cracker mix.
So easy and delicious, and a new family favorite.

OK, 2nd time around......i added roughly a 1/2 cup more PNB, kept butter amount the same and it was much better. Base held up well. I sprinkled the melted chips with powdered sugar instead of switching to milk chocolate chips and i thought that was also an improvement. by the way, because i only had cinnamon grahams on hand, that's what i used. These were delicious.

Um... I followed the recipe and process exactly and the mixture is super runny. Never had this happen with no-bake pb bars before. Guess I'll refrigerate after pouring into the pan and see what happens. In the meantime, I sure wish I had done more searching to find the recipe I used to use.

Love this and everyone I make them for ask me to make more! So easy and delicious. I have tried to make this a little "healthier" by only using 1 stick of butter and another time 1 and a half sticks of butter... this is one of those recipes to just follow. I made that mistake twice won't do it again. They don't firm up in that "bars" shape as well as just using the 2 sticks of butter. But, I highly recommend this recipe to everyone!
Wonderful, I just added an extra tablespoon of peanut butter to the chocolate.

The type of Graham cracker matters immensely. DO NOT USE THE BAG CRUMBS!! Use fresh crackers or the squares will turn out gritty. 

This recipe is 5 star when a quality graham cracker is used

This looked vey good but i didn't care for it. 
It wouldn't come out of the dish and it was just a pile of crumbs after several hours in the refrigerator.

:) Wow, these are great!
Peanut Butter and Chocolate are a great combination
For some reason my peanut butter layer comes out very soft. It creates an indentation of my finger when I pick it up. How can I fix this? Still tastes amazing though!
Amazing!
could of been 3 stars if the chocolate wasn't semi sweet

So good!!!!! I recommend greasing the pan though because it stuck to mine a little bit. I added sprinkles which made it extra cute! They don't taste exactly taste like reese's but still good! A little rich so if you have a sensitive stomach I recommend eating a small bit at a time. My family really enjoyed these and it's worth the time and ingredients!!

Love these. We ate them all the time growing up and a good gluten free version is to use 1 3/4 cups oat flour instead of graham crackers. If you use 2 cups it's too dry. I also like to put just chocolate on the top instead of chocolate/pb mix.

I think I saved this recipe to my box more than a year ago, but just tried it for the first time a few weeks ago. I hate working with sticky peanut butter, melting butter, melting chocolate, but this recipe is amazing and tastes perfect as written. It is surprisingly good! I’ve tried it with a 1/2 stick less of butter and that’s fine too. I would suggest lining the pan with parchment paper, which I didn’t do the first time and it was rough. I have to let people know I’ve made it so I don’t eat it all myself. Amazing! Just for reference, 4 Tablespoons is a quarter cup ??

Tasty for sure. 1st time I made it the filling didn't set up. The 2nd time, I used 2 full sleeves of the graham crackers and it was just right. I read some reviews where a whole bag of chips were used with 1/4 C peanut butter. I tried on my 2nd batch but the chocolate was too soft. I imagine it was from the extra peanut butter. Moral of the story, use 2 full sleeves of the graham crackers and use the chocolate chips & peanut butter as written.
They were so easy to make and my family loved them! I made them yesterday and half the pan is gone so far...
I love these
Easy & delicious! I substituted milk chocolate vs. the semi sweet chocolate chips suggested in the recipe. Thank you for sharing this recipe
Made per recipe. Tasted very good.
Love these
Made it once. Very good, especially considering I don't fancy peanut butter.
for the crust i used walnuts

These were super fast and easy and delish! I used milk chocolate chips and added a couple extra tablespoons of peanut butter so that the top was the consistency of firm fudge. It cut super easy with a warm knife and was easier to eat. I saw other reviews that said the topping was too hard! The extra peanut butter fixed that issue. Great recipes for kids to make!

Delicious and so easy to make. I second the suggestions in other reviews to pre-chill the base and keep the bars refrigerated, as the recipe as written will make the base a bit mushy. I suppose one could try just a touch less melted butter than recommended as well.
My family loves this at Christmas, just as it is.

I made it and it did not get firm on the crust. Checked the recipe three times to make sure I had done it correctly. After being in the fridge for a couple of hours I took it out to slice it and it will not hold together.
Any advice
Perfect. I am in love.
Made these bars as written and my family and coworkers loved them! Easy recipe and a great addition to my holiday baking.
Good but crust was a bit crumbly.

These are delicious and EASY! I followed the recipe but next time will use 1.5 sticks butter (instead of two sticks) and I also saw another note about graham cracker crumbs. I bought packaged graham cracker crumbs and next time will make them finer.

I think this recipe is great as is. If you're looking to change it up slightly- I tried adding a splash of vanilla to the peanut butter and I also had some Reese's peanut butter chips on hand and I topped the peanut butter layer with the Reese's chips ( I did not melt them- just left them as is) and poured the chocolate over that. Still super yummy.

Oh my goodness. This is such a good recipe. For the recipe police, yes, I made them the first time following the recipe. I would give it a 4.5, because they were too soft. The next time, I added about an extra 1/2 cup of powdered sugar to the peanut butter mix, and that solved the problem. Others may have done this, but I didn't have time to read all 2256 reviews. I also cut through the chocolate topping before they were set, scoring them, and had no problems with the topping chipping off. I put the bottom layer in the fridge for about 20 minutes while I was cooking up the topping, and it worked really well. Personally, I could do without the chocolate, because the bottom layer is so incredibly good. 

Just as an aside, if you don't have a food processor and just a blender, I had no trouble getting the graham crumbs. First I broke them into smaller pieces, then dropped them one by one into the spinning blades until I had about a cup of crumbs. Then they started to not blend well. I put them in a clean bowl and sifted through with my fingers to pick out pieces. I did another batch, then tossed them back in the blender and kept hitting my blender to make the crumbs fall back into the blade. I had no pieces afterwards.

I originally searched out this recipe because I needed to use up some ingredients. Now it has become a family favourite! A half recipe makes a 9” square pan. Shaking the pan lightly after adding the warm chocolate layer gives a nice smooth top.

LOVED these! My family not as much but then again, they're not as into peanut butter as I am. lol

TIP: make sure the graham cracker crumbs are finely chopped. Like corn meal consistency. Otherwise it doesn't stay together easy and isn't as smooth. 

I also one and halfed the peanut butter for the base layer and would probably reduce the amount of powdered sugar if I made these again. 

You could also dress these up by adding heath topping or reeses pieces. Delicious!

The only thing I did was add a little 1/2 tsp. vanilla to the peanut butter bottom, and a 1/2 tsp. vanilla to the chocolate drizzle, as it included some peanut butter as well. In my experience, vanilla brings out the peanut butter flavor in recipes so much better than peanut butter alone.
Was really good. Substituted the butter for canna butter. Very yummy
These were a huge hit. I will make it again for sure

My review sent before I was done writing. Love these and sometimes I put some butterscotch chips marbling in the chocolate chips after I spread into pan. I used natural Skippy peanut butter and it was a little soft but I put the peanut butter layer in the freezer while I was melting the chips. My husband's favorite!
I love these bars there just like eating Reese's cups! If you love Reese's you will love these! Try them you won’t regret it!

These are great just the way the recipe is written. I did use my processor to mix the bottom layer. By the way 2 packages of gram crackers equals 2 cups. The whole family loved them. Will make again, easy to make.
Something was off for me, a tad too much buttery taste, it felt more fattening than delicious which I know is a fine line, but it wasnt a treat to eat for other desserts with similar caloric values
The bottom is way too soft and grainy.
Fudge-like. Prefer the oatmeal kind.

I'm always a sucker for anything with chocolate and peanut butter. So of course I loved this recipe! Instead of using all semi sweet chocolate, I used half milk chocolate and half semi sweet. Made it taste great, not to sweet. This will be a go to for sure. The kiddos loved helping make this as well!

I want to note I've made this a dozen times before as written and it's delicious. However, I made one small change the last two times I made it, and it worked out nicely, so I thought I'd share. 

I've been trying to add flax seed and other fibers to my diet, so I replaced 1/2 cup of crushed graham crackers with 1/2 cup of ground flax seed (ground flax seed tastes like unsweetened graham crackers to me). I mixed the hot melted butter and graham/flax mixture and let it sit for about 20 minutes, until the butter was cool, to let it soak into and soften the flax seed and graham crackers before adding the rest of the ingredients, but that's it. I can't even tell! So if you're wanting to add a little more fiber to an otherwise deliciously indulgent recipe, I recommend trying some ground flax seed. The ones in the photo have been kept refrigerated because it's very hot here right now, but it tastes and feels just like the original recipe. As someone with sensory issues, I wouldn't eat it if it weren't.

amazing!!!!

all my family will not stop asking for me to make it now
Everyone in my house loved this recipe. I think the most interesting part is that it tastes almost exactly like a Reese's peanut butter cup!
Very sweet. Very easy to make.
It was very easy and delicious!
I made this for my uncle's birthday, everyone loved it. All I did was I used margarine instead of butter

I tried making these and there were just straight white clumps in it which is just clumps of sugar. Maybe I should try my electric mixer? Also don’t use semi sweet chocolate chips and it got hard in the fridge.

I looked at this recipe over and over again thinking I must've done something wrong... But it looks like I followed the recipe exactly and still ended up with a pretty dense PB bar and it looks nothing like the one pictured..
They are amazing

These are the most delicious peanut butter bars ever! Everyone in the family loved these. These were so simple to make and they have become one of the top favorite treats in the house. I do recommend using a food processor to crush up the graham crackers if you did not buy already crushed ones. This helps to make sure that your crust has no chunks. Overall this recipe is the bomb!

This should not be called a peanut butter bar. And no way is is better than a Reese's, sorry, lol. The graham cracker crumbs are just a filler and they add many un-needed calories and an off texture. If you have peanut butter loving kids or are a lover yourself I would opt on making peanut butter balls which are more the real deal.
These are so good and perfect for a hot summer day! It tastes just like Reese's peanut butter cups. My whole family loved them.
It was amazing! I do have a recommendation: Use a half-cup extra on the powdered sugar mix.

Super easy and delicious. Daughter wanted this as her bday cake this year because she doesn't like cakes much but loves chocolate and peanut butter. She was so happy and it came out delicious. I used real butter and if you use margarine you may not be as happy but it would still be good.
YUM!! definitely recommend!!

I used one bag of milk chocolate chips and added 1 stick of butter to them, along with the peanut butter for the topping and microwaved it all together, then stirred. This made a pourable chocolate topping that spread easily and evenly over the peanut butter layer. These are delicious, and I will be making them again!

I've made these a couple of times and made some adjustments that I really like. I used milk chocolate instead of dark and I halved the amount of butter and powdered sugar. I found that if I halved just the powdered sugar, then the crust becomes too soft because of all the butter. My kids love these and I've had to make them two days in a row while on quarantine!

I loved it. My friends gobbled it all up and said something about if I kept making this they would all need new pants. The only thing I did different was to use Hersey dark chocolate chips mostly due to that was what I had at the time to use. I am thinking of doing white chocolate next.
awesome.
Absolutely delicious!! I made no changes.
So good! Tastes kinda like reese cups. Crunchy peanut butter works great.
The Seniors that I made this for Loved them.

they were really good but you cant melt the chocolate in the microwave or else i t burns it told me to so I did but i had to melt the chocolate all over again and also wasted a bunch of the chocolate other then it was good it would have been 5 star if i didn't burn the chocolate

These are exactly what I was hoping they’d be! I actually forgot the 4 tbsp on peanut butter that was supposed to be added to the chocolate, and who cares! They are wonderful! Super easy for someone who loves to cook, but not so much on baking! Maybe it’s because I didn’t have to bake anything or use flour! Will make these until the end of time!

Great recipe -- delicious chocolate, peanut butter yumminess. 2 changes I'd suggest -- add finishing salt over the top, makes a big difference in flavor, and 2 line your pan with parchment or wax paper -- the recipe doesn't say to, but good lord it's hard to cut and get the bars out without it!
Super great!

Very good. Texture was very smooth, with the cracker crumbs kind of ruining the smoothness. I’m wondering if reducing the butter a bit would help balance out the textures of the ingredients. Overall, good and easy!
This recipe is amazing and I hope that other people love it to

A few suggestions. First refrigerate base before adding chocolate about 30 min. Second, after pouring chocolate on base refrigerate 5 min or so and then cut bars in the pan, actually like scoring them so when they are completely hard the chocolate doesn't crack while cutting.

I had to add nearly one more cup of powdered sugar. Perhaps the recipe writer got confused, and meant to type one stick of butter rather than one cup? Or maybe when typing, the finger hit the 2 rather than the 3 for powdered sugar? As written the peanut butter/ cracker layer is soupy. I just added more sugar to make a dough that looked similar to the video. Many other reviewers said theirs was too thin as well, so there has to be a mistake somewhere. It tasted great, but just be warned of the extra needed powdered sugar.
Tried the recipe as is and it’s so good!!!

Made exactly as instructed, using butter. I am a professional baker, and this is my Pro tip: if you use margarine, don’t use the stuff from the tub, use the hard stuff that comes wrapped like butter. The higher fat content is what will make it set properly. 
I lined my 9x13 with parchment paper so the bars would easily lift out of the pan. I also used plastic wrap over the peanut butter layer to press it down and smooth out. The plastic then peels right off and gives a nice even surface for coating with the chocolate layer. 
I thought they were great, my husband said they resembled fudge too much for his liking. 
These took about 10 minutes to make, I chilled them about 30 minutes, cut, and then chilled about an hour longer. 
I will definitely make them again, and will try reducing the butter a little bit and upping the peanut butter in the first layer. A sprinkle of coarse salt on top would be a nice addition too!
Sooo good. Brought them to work and everyone was addicted! Will make again
I followed recipe exactly and it turned out thin and very moist..it can't be pressed into pan...ill us b e to try to bake it to firm it up..disappointed!
I don’t put the peanut butter in the chocolate. Also, I make these with Wowbutter. They taste just the same. I am allergic to peanut and tree nuts so I improvise.

This was easy to make. Might be good to clarify amount of peanut butter in step two, for those of us that skip around while making a recipe. I accidentally used a cup with the chocolate chips instead of 4 tablespoons, though don't think it will matter too much. Will update if needed once we taste it. Is for my husband's birthday treat, said he remembers them serving something like this in the lunchroom when he was a kid. We'll see if it lives up! Lol

This was trying to be candy. Not a cookie bar. Showed up top of the list when searching for peanut butter cookie bar. It was so sweet and mushy. Was going to bring to someone’s party but that would be embarrassing. I’ll have to stop at the bakery now. What a waste of time and money. I don’t know why this had high ratings unless your looking for a sugar high. May as well buy Reese’s cups.
These were really good! I'm new to cooking/baking at home, so I'm amazed I can make stuff that's generally easy and delicious. These peanut butter bars tasted exactly like Reese's Peanut Butter Cups.
